title: What compensation are you seeking
h1: What compensation are you seeking? (to do)

collapsableSection1.linkText: Compensation - what can a tribunal award?
collapsableSection1.p1: If a tribunal decides you’ve been unfairly dismissed, you’ll normally receive compensation which is made up of:
collapsableSection1.li1: a basic award - fixed sum worked out using a standard formula
collapsableSection1.li2: a compensatory award - compensation for the actual money you lost due to your dismissal
collapsableSection1.p2: Compensation can be reduced for various reasons and a tribunal will tell you more about this if it applies in your specific circumstances.
collapsableSection1.p3: In disciplinary or grievance cases, you may be entitled to an increased award if an employer fails to follow the guidance set out in the Acas Code of Practice on disciplinary and grievance procedures.
collapsableSection1.p4: Similarly, awards can be reduced if a tribunal decides you’ve failed to follow the guidance set out in the Acas Code of Practice on disciplinary and grievance procedures.
collapsableSection1.p5: In certain claims, such as those involving discrimination, a tribunal may compensate you for ‘injury to feelings’ (individual hurt and distress you may have suffered) in addition to compensation for financial loss.
